page.title: 05STAINES BOWLS CLUB
page.content: { Staines Bowls Club}started in 1920.The first President was Mr.Fox Warren who was on the board of Ashby's Brewery(now Courages).He and others put up the money for the first green to be built near Tothill Street opposite the Pack Horse Hotel.The Club played there until the Council decided to build a road behind Staines High Street and all existing premises were purchased with a view to building South Street and the new shopping centre. The Club moved first to a Council green at Fordbridge Park and then to the green at Knowle Green where the Club now has it's home.
